intro: Arenaria longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It typically features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in late summer. The plant has a mat-forming growth habit with many slender stems that often root at the nodes. Its leaves are usually narrow and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in harsh environments. Arenaria longipes is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to cold climates.
